Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Camilla S
Reviews.Content: We were in i Barcelona for 5 days in mid April 2012, and had a perfect stay at Las Ramblas Apartments III. Simple, clean, and had everything we (4 adults and 4 children from 0-12 years) needed). Great with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms! The top rating achieved by the location, only two blocks away from Pl Catalunya! Easy walking distance from everything you would like to see in Barcelona. Pick upp point for key a 15 min walk away, nice friendly staff. Can warmly recommend this to other travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good standard and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Eivind T
Reviews.Content: The apartment has a great location near Las Ramblas. A bit noisy trafic during the day, but not more than expected in a big city. Great budget for travelling with groups. Clean apartment wtih the option to cook your own food.

Reviews.Title: “Las Ramblas III Apartment”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: Great location (minute away from main strip Las Ramblas, close to tour bus stop), clean, fully equipped, friendly and attentive staff. Great budget for travelling with groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great price needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: Verityprudenc
Reviews.Content: The las ramblas 111 apartment are located very convieniantly near the urquinnaona metro station and are in a great place for getting to the ramblas and surrounding shopping district in a side street that is very busy by day but very quiet at night there are Plenty shops cares and other food outlets very close The apartment is spacious with three bed rooms (1 ensuit & 2 share a bathroom ) off one main sitting dining room there is also a good sized kitchen with everything you could need for a self catering short break The down side is that all the fixtures fittings and furniture are from ikea and of a very low standard so there is no feeling of luxury but fine as a basic standard, the rooms also could do with a reprint as the walls really are quiet dirty Would I stay here again defiantly this is a great deal forva very cheap get away the apartment can sleep 6 ( although there where only three of us) so the price could work out low per head this is not the place I would bring my mum to or if I was trying to impress my partner on a romantic break but forva group of friend want a good deal to be able to go shopping sight seeing and partying this would make an ideal base

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AZLee
Reviews.Content: The best thing about these apartments would be its central location! Just 5 mins' walk from Las Ramblas and Pl.Catalunya, from where we could branch out anywhere by Metro or by bus. Having read some earlier reviews about how some people arrived to find no record of their reservations (though that was for Ramblas I or II, not Ramblas III), we took the precaution of calling them up a week before our arrival to check on our reservations. We were a group of 14, and took a 3-br unit for 8 pax and a 2-br unit for 6 pax. They confirmed both our reservations were intact. A few days before check-in, we received an e-mail reminding us that check-in was at C.Pau Claris, a different location from the apartments. We found the apartments surprisingly spacious for such a central location. Usually, the more central, the smaller the space simply because space would be a premium, right? Besides reasonably spacious bedrooms (where we could leave our big bags opened on the floor and still have space left to walk!), spacious living room with 2 sofas (1 of which could be opened up to become a sofabed) with a dining table, there was also a spacious kitchen with another table for dining. The central location meant we could go out for the day, return to the apartment for a rest and then go out again for dinner or shopping. The only dampener is that one had to check-in at a different location (1 Metro stop or 15 mins' walk from Pl.Catalunya) - imagine having just arrived in the city (i.e. total strangers to the city) laden with luggage and then having to look first for the check-in premises and then for the apartment itself. For my group, we had loads of people and luggage, so we took the easy way out by calling a taxi. The airport info counter furnished us with a list of numbers to call for taxis and we took two 7-seater vans. The drivers first drove us to Pau Claris for check-in, waited whilst 2 of us went into the building to attend to the check-in and after that, drove us to the apartments. The cost was not that high (55 Euros incl. tips, per car), divided by 14 of us, but it might be rather costly if there were only 1 or 2 of you. But hassle aside, the check-in staff at Pau Claris was great - Vicky who attended to us spoke fluent English and was most courteous and helpful. One further puzzling thing was : Both our apartments had washing machines. Those of us in the 3-br unit happily washed our dirty clothes in it but the machine in the other unit didn't work, so we called Pau Claris to report to them. We were told that we were not supposed to use the washing machine! Apparently they were only for the use of the housekeeping people to wash the linens, and that "washing machine" was not listed in the list of amenities for the Apartments (I didn't notice!). Anyway, I would strongly suggest to the owner to include this in the apartment! There was no dryer so I had to send out SOS to Tripadvisor forummers to ask where the nearest laundry was - within a short span of time, I'd been given directions to the nearest one 3 mins' walk away!! Thanks folks!! Tip : When you check in at C.Pau Claris, they give you lots of discount vouchers, in a booklet - lots of great discounts! For the hop-on hop off Bus Turistic, they also gave a separate voucher for 6 Euros discount. This is very good - other vouchers typically give only 10% discount but here we got 6Euros discount (approx 25%). Please ask them to give you 1 discount booklet and 1 Bus Turistic voucher for EACH member of your group, as most of the vouchers are only valid for 1 person. In our case, there were 14 of us but they only gave us 4 or 5 booklets. By the time we went through the booklets and realised we needed 14 booklets, we had to go back to C.Pau Claris to collect more booklets. Their staff there was most obliging and immediately said "Of course" when we called up to enquire if we could be given 1 booklet for each pax in our group - however, it have been better if they'd given that no. of booklets to us upon check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place, price and location”
Reviews.Author: Juan L
Reviews.Content: Great location, not expensive at all, nice staff. They moved us due to a problem with the other department to a better location without any extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Barcelona. A bit run down but does the job for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LynnMalM
Reviews.Content: We were a group of five who recently stayed at the Las Ramblas Apartments III for a weekend break, our appartment was on floor 2 room 1. Overall we had a comfortable stay for the price we paid. The location is first class as it is very central for all the local attrations, it is only a few minutes walk to the top of Las Ramblas. Our appartment had three double bedrooms all with air conditioning, two bathrooms with toilet, bidet and baths with showers. The living area was spacious with a dining table and one sofa, the tv was a little outdated with a small stereo to play music. The kitchen was ok but a bit run down with broken tiles on the floor. The appartment was in need of a little overhall as it was starting to look a bit run down, the safe went on the blink which became frustrating. We got a taxi from the airport to the b&b in town to collect the keys for the appartment which was a little inconvenient as it was about a 15 minute walk from the b&b to the appartment. I think if these appartments were given a lick of paint and one or two things replaced it would be a first class appartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: eyemouthboy
Reviews.Content: If you want a city centre basic budget apartment then this is for you. Very close to the city centre it makes a great base for seeing the sights. It's very basic so dont expect any luxury, there is a lot of noise from the busy street below and there is no chance of sitting on the balcony chilling out in the sunshine. I get the feeling that most apartments in Barcelona would be similar so if you want a better accomodation then it would need to be a hotel. All in all it was handy for a location but a let down for comfort

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Natalia_Akimova
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona with my 4 friends and stayed here for 6 days. We booked 2br/2b apartment online. When we arrived we had to pick up keys at the hotel located few blocks away from our place (about 15 minutes walking) and place a deposit of 300 euro. It was pleasure for us to take a walk there but someone could find it inconvenient. The apartment is not for the experienced traveler who expects class style and service but it is clean, has a simple contemporary decor and absolutely everything to provide a comfortable stay for a group of friends or family. Las Ramblas Appartments III has a great location at the city center only 2 blocks away from the main square Placa Catalunya and Las Rambla. The metro station Urquinaona is just 50 steps away and Palace of Catalan Music is around the corner. The Boqueria Market is 5-7 minutes walking distance from the appartment and kitchen has everything needed for cooking. We enjoyed making dinner of fresh fish and vegetables. Everything in the apartment was just as we expected except of that there were no cold water in kitchen and shower curtain was missing. But we were so excited about the city and had so much fun that never called or visited manager. I'm quite sure that if we did, they could fix it immidiately - the desk stuff seemed to be friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and would reccomend Las Ramblas Appartments III to a group of friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Handy & adequate”
Reviews.Author: Alan186342
Reviews.Content: The big pain with these apatments is having to pick the keys up from quite some way away and then make your way to them. The apartment is in a great location but are only passable in quality. The rooms are reasonably furnished but a bit worn and tired,the safe would'nt work, and we had problems with the door lock (down to lack of info.) When we arrived, well after check in time, the apartment was still being cleaned and therefore rushed. There was also noise disruption from a lower apartment. They served their purpose but we would go somewhere else if we return

Reviews.Title: “Great Appts...Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: NigelandGillian
Reviews.Content: We booked this back in February this year after reading a few few ok reviews. We planned this trip on a tight budget and really only wanted somewhere to lay our heads. Prior to travel I read several bad reviews of the Las Ramblas...and to be honest was a little put off and expected the worse. I can honestly say that we were all very happy when we arrived...It's a Spacious appt with 2 rooms containing 2 single beds with en suit access and double bed, again with en -suit access and then a double sofa bed in the main living space. There is a fully functional kitchen with fridge and cooking & dining facilities...along with enough towels for all (8 People) and a working TV and Hi-FI. The location of the appts is great...it's central, 5 mins walk to the main Ramblas street and the Metro is right out side. You do have to go 6 blocks up the road to collect the keys and to be honest if i'd know a little earlier that the day before I'd have included the metro stop up in my hand outs so i didn't have to walk...Although we did discover a pretty small but cool bar serving Van Domm (I think) i nice local bitter (beir) I would certainly recommend this to anyone and with Barcelona being such an expensive city (4.90 Euro for Guinness in small Irish Bars, 6 Euro in centrally located bars) If you travel light and want a great value for money stay in an expensive city...This has to be your place! My only issue was the traffic noise...If you're not a drinker and are a light sleeper...This probably would get right on your nerves and completely ruin you stay! Any Questions, please let me know!

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: n87
Reviews.Content: Firstly we had to go pick up our keys from a place that was at least 25mins walk from the apartments. The apartment was very big and spacious with 2 seperate bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a living area and a big kitchen with clothes washing facilites, however, it was VERY run down and wasn't anything like the photos. There was no air con in the lounge/living area so it was absolutely boiling and the lights in both bedrooms were not working. The pillows on the beds were terrible and there were no sheets on the bed. We couldn't get the safe working, so we asked them to come fix our lights and safe but in the 5 days we were there, they never came. Thankfully there was a washing machine to wash our laundry but there was no dryer or clothes line to dry everything. The place was left pretty dirty from the previous people and they then expected us to clean and wash everything before we checked out. Overall, we were quite disappointed with the place but it was in a good location, close to the main streets for restaurants and shopping.

HotelInfo.Name: Las Ramblas Apartments III
HotelInfo.Address: Jonqueres 13, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
